derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Dutch mof, Middle Dutch muffel, from medieval Latin muff(u)la, of unknown ultimate origin

entry.def: If you muff something, you do it badly or you make a mistake while you are doing it, so that it is not successful.
A muff is a piece of fur or thick cloth shaped like a short hollow cylinder. You wear a muff on your hands to keep them warm in cold weather.
Muffs are the same as earmuffs .

means.word_mean: 1. a warm tubular covering for the hands
1. fail to catch, as of a ball
2. make a mess of, destroy or ruin;

sentences.sentence: "I botched the dinner and we had to eat out"
"the pianist screwed up the difficult passage in the second movement"
